thread.title: Magazine publishes Obama interview from Des Moines
thread.title_full: Magazine publishes Obama interview from Des Moines

title: Magazine publishes Obama interview from Des Moines
text:
Magazine publishes Obama interview from Des Moines Register staff 5:06 p.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Buy Photo President Barack Obama arrives at the State Library with Iowa author Marilynne Robinson, left, in Des Moines, Iowa, Monday Sept. 14, 2015. (Photo: Rodney White/The Register) Buy Photo CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The first part of an interview conducted in Des Moines between President Barack Obama and Pulitzer-Prize winning Iowa writer Marilynne Robinson is now online . 
Before Obama spoke at a town hall meeting on education at North High School in September, he made a stop at the State Library in the State Capitol complex to do the interview for The New York Review of Books. 
In the interview, Obama is very complimentary of Robinson's work, particularly her 2004 novel "Gilead," which he says he picked up in Iowa while campaigning for president. Buy Photo 
President Barack Obama laughs with State Librarian Michael Scott at the State Library in Des Moines, Iowa, Monday Sept. 14, 2015. (Photo: Rodney White/The Register) 
Later, he talks about his experience first campaigning in Iowa: 
"It’s interesting, because we’re talking in Iowa; people always, I think, were surprised about me connecting with folks in small-town Iowa. And the reason I did was, first of all, I had the benefit that at the time nobody expected me to win. And so I wasn’t viewed through this prism of Fox News and conservative media, and making me scary. At the time, I didn’t seem scary, other than just having a funny name. I seemed young. Sometimes I look at my pictures from then and I say, I can’t believe anybody voted for me because I look like I’m twenty-five." 
Read the entire first part of the interview at NYBooks.com. The interview will be published in the Nov. 5 issue of The New York Review of Books. Read or Share this story: http://dmreg.co/1RDfHXB TOP VIDEOS
